intro: Blepharis hirta, commonly known as the hairy blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes at the tips of the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Blepharis hirta is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its drought tolerance.
